page.title: 03History of the Camp Area
page.content: On the outskirts of{St. Albans}is a district called{the Camp,}because a volunteer camp had been held there in the late 19th Century.{St. Peter's {Rural School Board}was set up in{1878 and from then on several schools were built including{Camp School,}which is the only one still in use as a school. Originally these were elementary schools which catered for all ages. The area was being built up just before the{1914-1918 war.}The printing press for the{Salvation Army}was started then as{Campfield Press;}it is still there. There was also a clothing factory,{Aquascutum.}In{Sutton Road near to Camp School, there was a {railway bridge}which carried the branch line to Hatfield. It was always flooded beneath the bridge when it rained. I saw an old photograph of this. The bridge no longer exists.
